questions.Question: You can check the conditions against __________ when applying conditional formatting
questions.solution: Solution:		We can check the conditions against Cell value or Formula when applying conditional formatting.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not true regarding Conditional Formatting?
questions.optionA: You can add more than one condition to check
questions.optionB: You can set condition to look for Bold and apply Italics on them
questions.optionC: You can apply Font, border and pattern formats that meets the specified conditions
questions.optionD: You can delete any condition from Conditional Formatting dialog box if it is not requried
questions.solution: Solution:		In Conditional Formatting we cannot set condition to look for Bold and apply Italics on them.

questions.Question: Which of the following is invalid statement?
questions.optionB: Some picture can be applied as a background of a sheet
questions.optionC: You can set the column width automatically fit the amount of text
questions.optionD: The width of a row and be specified manually or fit automatically
questions.solution: Solution:		The width of a row and be specified manually or fit automatically is invalid statement.

questions.Question: You can use the formula palette to
questions.optionB: Create and edit formula containing functions
questions.solution: Solution:		Formula palette is used to create and edit formula. Itisalsopossibletotypeafunctiondirectlyintoacell,however,asthereareover300 functionsbuiltintoMicrosoftExcel,someofwhicharequitecomplex,Excelprovidesthe Formula Palette to simplify the process.

questions.Question: When a range is selected, how can you activate the previous cell?
questions.solution: Solution:		To go to previous cell we use Go To function Ctrl + G.

questions.Question: You can use drag-and-drop to embed excel worksheet data in a word document
questions.optionA: By dragging a range of excel data to the word button on the taskbar while pressing the Ctrl key
questions.optionB: By dragging a range of excel data to the word button on the taskbar while pressing Shift key
questions.optionC: By dragging a range of excel data to the word button on the taskbar while pressing Alt key
questions.solution: Solution:		We can use drag-and-drop to embed excel worksheet data in a word document by dragging a range of excel data to the word button on the taskbar while pressing the Ctrl key.

questions.Question: The auto calculate feature
questions.optionA: Can only add values in a range of cells
questions.optionB: Provides a quick way to view the result of an arithmetic operation on a range of cells
questions.optionC: Automatically creates formulas and adds them to a worksheet
questions.solution: Solution:		The auto calculate feature provides a quick way to view the result of an arithmetic operation on a range of cells.

questions.Question: Excel uniquely identifies cells within a worksheet with a cell name
questions.solution: Solution:		Column letters and row numbers in Excel uniquely identifies cells within a worksheet with a cell name.

questions.Question: The Delete key of keyboard is assigned to which command in Excel?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Delete key of keyboard is assigned to Clear Contents command in Excel. Clear Contents will clear only the data, will not clear any formats.

questions.Question: If you need to remove only the formatting done in a range (numbers and formula typed there should not be removed), you must
questions.optionA: From Edit menu choose Clear and then Formats
questions.optionC: Click on Remove Formatting tool on Standard Toolbar
questions.optionD: Double click the Format Painter and then press Esc key in keyboard
questions.solution: Solution:		If we need to remove only the formatting done in a range, we must use From Edit menu choose Clear and then Formats.

questions.Question: By default Excel provides 3 worksheets. You need only two of them, how will you delete the third one?
questions.optionA: Right click on Sheet Tab of third sheet and choose Delete from the context menu
questions.optionB: Click on Sheet 3 and from Edit menu choose Delete
questions.solution: Solution:		Right-click the tab and choose Delete from its shortcut menu in All version of excel. In Microsoft Excel 2010 onwards Choose Home > Delete > Delete Sheet on the Ribbon, press Alt+HDS Microsoft Excel 2007 and earlier Press ‘ALT’ + ‘E’, then the ‘L’ key.

questions.Question: Which of the following action removes a sheet from workbook?
questions.optionA: Select the sheet, then choose Edit > Delete Sheet
questions.optionB: Select the sheet then choose Format > Sheet > Hide
questions.solution: Solution:		To removes a sheet from workbook select the sheet, then choose Edit > Delete Sheet these options available in excel 2003 and earlier version. In Microsoft Excel 2007 onward Choose Home > Delete > Delete Sheet on the Ribbon.

questions.Question: While Finding and Replacing some data in Excel, which of the following statement is valid?
questions.optionA: You can Find and Replace within the sheet or workbook
questions.optionB: Excel does not have option to match case for find
questions.solution: Solution:		In Excel we can Find and Replace within the sheet or workbook.

questions.Question: Getting data from a cell located in a different sheet is called ________
questions.solution: Solution:		Getting data from a cell located in a different sheet is called Cell reference. There are Three types of Cell reference in ExcelRelativeAbsoluteMixed

questions.Question: Tab scrolling button
questions.optionA: Allow you to view a different worksheet
questions.optionB: Allow you to view additional worksheet rows down
questions.optionC: Allow you to view additional worksheet columns to the right
questions.optionD: Allow you to view additional sheets tabs
questions.solution: Solution:		Tab scrolling button allow us to view additional sheets tabs.

questions.Question: A numeric value can be treated as a label value if it precedes with
questions.solution: Solution:		An apostrophe before a cell value forces Excel to interpret the value as label. This is mostly useful for values that look like a number or date.

questions.Question: Concatenation of text can be done using
questions.solution: Solution:		Concatenation of text can be done using Ampersand (&).

questions.Question: Data can be arranged in a worksheet in a easy to understand manner using
questions.solution: Solution:		Data can be arranged in a worksheet in a easy to understand manner using all or any of the above options.

questions.Question: Which of the following will not cut information?
questions.optionB: Selecting Edit > Cut from the menu
questions.optionC: Clicking the Cut button on the standard
questions.solution: Solution:		Pressing Ctrl+C when one or more cell is highlighted copies the cell's contents into the clipboard.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not a way to complete a cell entry?
questions.optionB: Pressing any arrow key on the keyboard
questions.optionC: Clicking the Enter button on the Formula bar
questions.solution: Solution:		When we press the spacebar, it selects the current cell for editing.

questions.Question: You can activate a cell by
questions.solution: Solution:		A cell can be ready to activate by any of the method Pressing the Tab key or Clicking the cell or Pressing an arrow key.

questions.Question: Text formulas:
questions.solution: Solution:		Concatenate and manipulate text

questions.Question: How do you insert a row?
questions.optionA: Right-click the row heading where you want to insert the new row and select Insert from the shortcut menu
questions.optionB: Select the row heading where you want to insert the new row and select Edit >Row from the menu
questions.optionC: Select the row heading where you want to insert the new row and click the Insert Row button on the standard toolbar
questions.solution: Solution:		Right-click the row heading where you want to insert the new row and select Insert from the shortcut menu in Excel 2003.Form 2007 and higher version Home > Insert > Insert Sheet Rows.

questions.Question: You can merge the main document with data source in Excel. In mail merge operation, Word is usually
questions.solution: Solution:		You can merge the main document with data source in Excel. In mail merge operation, Word is usually Client

questions.Question: How can you update the values of formula cells if Auto Calculate mode of Excel is disabled?
questions.solution: Solution:		Manual calculation mode means that Excel will only recalculate all open workbooks when we request it by pressing F9. It allows to choose whether we want to update formulas in worksheets or entire workbook.

questions.Question: You want to set such that when you type Baishakh and drag the fill handle, Excel should produce Jestha, Aashadh and so on. What will you set to effect that?
questions.solution: Solution:		Use a Custom list to sort or fill in a user-defined order. Excel provides day-of-the-week and month-of-the year built-in lists, but we can also create your own custom list. For Excel 2010 and later, click File > Options > Advanced > General > Edit Custom Lists. For Excel 2007, click the Microsoft Office Button Office button > Excel Options > Popular >Top options for working with Excel > Edit Custom Lists.

questions.Question: Where can you change automatic or manual calculation mode in Excel?
questions.optionA: Double CAL indicator on status bar
questions.optionB: Go to File > Options > Formulas > Calculation Option - and mark the corresponding radio button
questions.solution: Solution:		When you press F9 or click Calc Sheet on the Calculation tab on the Tools/Options menu. Calculation also occurs every time that you save the file if you have the checkbox "Recalculate workbook before saving" checked under File > Options > Formulas.

questions.Question: How can you show or hide the gridlines in Excel Worksheet?
questions.optionA: Go to Tools > Options > View tab and mark or remove the check box named Gridline
questions.optionB: Click Gridline tool on Forms toolbar
questions.solution: Solution:		In Excel 2016, 2013, 2010, 2007, click on View > Show > Gridlines For Excel 2003 and Earlier: Navigate to Tools > Options or Click Gridline tool on Forms toolbar.

questions.Question: In EXCEL, you can sum a large range of data by simply selecting a tool button called ________.
questions.solution: Solution:		AutoSum is a Microsoft Excel function that adds together a range of cells and displays the total in the cell below the selected range.

questions.Question: To select an entire column in MS-EXCEL, press?
questions.solution: Solution:		To select an entire column in MS-EXCEL, Click the column heading letter or press CTRL + Space Bar key.

questions.Question: To return the remainder after a number is divided by a divisor in EXCEL we use the function?
questions.solution: Solution:		The MOD function in Excel is used to find remainder after division of one number (dividend) by another (divisor). In mathematics, this operation is called the modulo operation or modulus, hence the name MOD.

questions.Question: Which function is not available in the Consolidate dialog box?
questions.solution: Solution:

questions.Question: Which is not the function of "Edit, Clear" command?
questions.solution: Solution:

questions.Question: Which of the following is not true about Find and Replace in Excel
questions.optionA: You can search for bold and replace with italics
questions.optionB: You can decide whether to look for the whole word or not
questions.optionC: You can search in formula too
questions.optionD: You can search by rows or columns or sheets
questions.solution: Solution:

questions.Question: You can move a sheet from one workbook into new book by
questions.optionA: From Edit menu choose Move or Copy sheet, mark the Create a ccopy and Click OK
questions.optionB: From Edit menu choose Move of Copy then choose (Move to end) and click OK
questions.optionC: From Edit menu choose Move or Copy then select (new book) from To Book list and click OK
questions.solution: Solution:		From Edit menu choose Move or Copy then select (new book) from To Book list and click OK

questions.Question: What is the shortcut key to replace a data with another in sheet?
questions.solution: Solution:Ctrl + H shortcut key is usedto replace a data with another in sheet.

questions.Question: Comments can be added to cells using ________
questions.solution: Solution:		Comments can be added to cells using Insert > Comment.

questions.Question: Which menu option can be used to split windows into two?
questions.solution: Solution:View > Window > Split option can be used to split windows into two.

questions.Question: When you link data maintained in an excel workbook to a word document
questions.optionA: The word document cannot be edit
questions.optionB: The word document contains a reference to the original source application
questions.optionC: The word document must contain a hyperlink
questions.optionD: The word document contains a copy of the actual data
questions.solution: Solution:		When we link data maintained in an excel workbook to a word document the document contains a reference to the original source application.

questions.Question: Which area in an excel window allows entering values and formulas
questions.solution: Solution:		Formula Bar is where data or formulas we enter into a worksheet appear for the active cell. The Formula Bar can also be used to edit data or formula in the active cell.

questions.Question: To hold row and column titles in place so that they do not scroll when you scroll a worksheet click the
questions.optionA: Unfreeze panes command on the window menu
questions.optionB: Freeze panes command on the window menu
questions.optionC: Hold titles command on the edit menu
questions.optionD: Split command on the window menu
questions.solution: Solution:		When we want to scroll down the worksheet, and lock the heading rows in place, so it is always visible, we can use one of the Freeze Panes commands.

questions.Question: To edit in an embedded excel worksheet object in a word document
questions.optionA: Use the excel menu bar and toolbars inside the word application
questions.optionC: Edit the data in a excel source application
questions.optionD: Use the word menu bar and toolbars
questions.solution: Solution:		Use the excel menu bar and toolbars inside the word application to edit in an embedded excel worksheet object in a word document.

questions.Question: To create a formula, you can use:
questions.optionC: Values or cell references although not both at the same time
questions.solution: Solution:		To create a formula, we can use value and cell references both.

questions.Question: Excel displays the current cell address in the ________
questions.solution: Solution:		Name Box refers to an input box directly to the left of the formula bar. The Name Box normally displays the address of the "active cell" on the worksheet. You can also use the name box to quickly create a named range.

questions.Question: What is the correct way to refer the cell A10 on sheet3 from sheet1?
questions.solution: Solution:		First we use the name of sheet, then put an exclamation mark, at the end give the cell reference. It would be look like =Sheet3!A10

questions.Question: Which language is used to create macros in Excel?
questions.solution: Solution:		VBA (Visual Basic for Applications) is the programming language of Excel with VBA we can automate tasks in Excel by writing so called macros.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not a term of MS-Excel?
questions.solution: Solution:		A worksheet in Excel is made up of Rows and Columns. Intersection of a Row and column in an Excel worksheet is a rectangle called as a Cell. Cells store a value, a formula, or text.

questions.Question: How many worksheets can a workbook have?
questions.solution: Solution:		Excel does not limit the number of sheets, so it is only limited by available memory on your computer (RAM). This means the max number of sheets is higher on computers with more memory.

questions.Question: Which of the following is a popular DOS based spreadsheet package?
questions.solution: Solution:		Lotus 1-2-3 spreadsheet was the first MS-DOS based spreadsheet package which was released on January 26, 1983. It was the IBM PC's first killer application, was hugely popular in the 1980s, displacing the former leader VisiCalc and contributed significantly to the success of the IBM PC. Lotus had difficulties adapting 1-2-3 to the Windows environment, and was overtaken by Microsoft Excel.

questions.Question: An excel workbook is a collection of
questions.solution: Solution:		A workbook is a collection of one or more spreadsheets and charts in a single file.

questions.Question: Excel files have a default extension of in Excel-2003
questions.solution: Solution:		Excel files have a default extension of xls in 2003 and earlier version of MS-office and xlxs in 2007 and higher version of MS-office.

questions.Question: You can use the format painter multiple times before you turn it off by
questions.optionA: You can use the format painter button on ly one time when you click it
questions.optionB: Double clicking the format painter button
questions.optionC: Pressing the Ctrl key and clicking the format painter button
questions.optionD: Pressing the Alt key and clicking the format painter button
questions.solution: Solution:		We can use the format painter multiple times before we turn it off by double clicking the format painter button.

questions.Question: You can use the formula palette to
questions.optionB: Create and edit formulas containing functions
questions.solution: Solution:		Formula palette is used to create and edit formula. Itisalsopossibletotypeafunctiondirectlyintoacell,however,asthereareover300 functionsbuiltintoMicrosoftExcel,someofwhicharequitecomplex,Excelprovidesthe Formula Palette to simplify the process.

questions.Question: Comments put in cells are called
questions.solution: Solution:		Comments put in cells are called Cell Tip

questions.Question: Which is used to perform what if analysis?
questions.solution: Solution:		Goal seek, Scenario Manager and Solver are used to perform what if analysis in Excel.

questions.Question: You can use the horizontal and vertical scroll bars to
questions.optionA: Split a worksheet into two panes
questions.optionB: View different rows and columns edit the contents of a cell
questions.optionC: Edit the contents of a cell
questions.solution: Solution:		You can use the horizontal and vertical scroll bars to view different rows and columns edit the contents of a cell.

questions.Question: Multiple calculations can be made in a single formula using
questions.solution: Solution:		An array formula is a formula that can perform multiple calculations on one or more of the items in an array. We can think of an array as a row of values, a column of values, or a combination of rows and columns of values. Array formulas can return either multiple results or a single result. For example, we can create an array formula in a range of cells and use the array formula to calculate a column or row of subtotals. We can also place an array formula in a single cell and calculate a single amount. An array formula that includes multiple cells is called a multi-cell formula, and an array formula in a single cell is called a single-cell formula.

questions.Question: Hyperlinks can be
questions.solution: Solution:		Hyperlinks can be a text or drawing objects or pictures. A hyperlink is a word, phrase, or image that we can click on to jump to a new file or a new section within the current file.

questions.Question: To save a workbook, you:
questions.optionA: Click the save button on the standard toolbar from the menu
questions.optionC: Click Save on the Windows Start button
questions.solution: Solution:		Click the save button on the standard toolbar from the menu

questions.Question: You can edit a cell by
questions.optionB: Double clicking the cell to edit it in-place
questions.optionC: Selecting Edit > Edit Cell from the menu
questions.solution: Solution:		Double clicking the cell to edit it in-place

questions.Question: You can select a single range of cells by
questions.optionA: Clicking the upper-left cell in a group of cells and then pressing the Shift key while clicking the lower right cell in a group of cells
questions.optionB: Pressing the Ctrl key while dragging over the desired cells
questions.optionC: Pressing the Shift key and an arrow key
questions.solution: Solution:		We can select a single range of cells by dragging cursor over the desired cells.

questions.Question: Which elements of worksheet can be protected from accidental modification
questions.solution: Solution:		All elements of a worksheet can be protected from accidental modification.To protect a worksheet in Excel 2007 and higher versions, click the Review tab, click Protect Worksheet (or Protect Sheet), and click OK.Excel 2003 and Earlier Versions click Tools > Protection, click Protect Sheet, and click OK.

questions.Question: You can use the drag and drop method to
questions.solution: Solution:		Drag-and-drop is a mouse technique that we can use in Excel to pick up a cell selection and drop it into a new place on the worksheet. Although drag and drop is primarily a technique for moving cell entries around a worksheet, we can also adapt it to copy a cell selection.

questions.Question: Which of the following format you can decide to apply or not in AutoFormat dialog box?
questions.solution: Solution:		AutoFormat option in excel is a unique way of formatting data quickly, the first step is we need to select the entire data we need to format and then the second step we need to click on auto-format from the QAT and third step we need to choose the format from the different options.

questions.Question: How can you remove borders applied in cells?
questions.optionA: Choose None on Border tab of Format cells
questions.optionB: Open the list on Border tool in Format Cell toolbar then choose first tool (none)
questions.solution: Solution:		On the Home tab, in the Font group, click the arrow next to Borders Button, and then click No Border Button. --OR-- Click Home > the Borders arrow > Erase Border, and then select the cells with the border you want to erase.

questions.Question: Where can you set the shading color for a range of cells in Excel?
questions.optionA: Choose required color form Patterns tab of Format Cells dialog box
questions.optionB: Choose required color on Fill Color tool in Formatting toolbar
questions.optionC: Choose required color on Fill Color tool in Drawing toolbar
questions.solution: Solution:		The formatting and Drawing toolbar is a toolbar in Microsoft Office 2003 and earlier applications, that gives the user the ability to change the formatting of selected text or cell.

questions.Question: You can set Page Border in Excel from
questions.optionA: From Border tab in Format Cells dialog box
questions.optionB: From Border tool in Formatting toolbar
questions.optionC: From Line Style tool in Drawing toolbar
questions.optionD: You can not set page border in Excel
questions.solution: Solution:		There is no option to set page border in Excel.

questions.Question: When all the numbers between 0 and 100 in a range should be displayed in Red Color, apply
questions.optionA: Use =if() function to format the required numbers red
questions.optionB: Apply Conditional Formatting command on Format menu
questions.optionC: Select the cells that contain number between 0 and 100 then click Red color on Text Color tool
questions.solution: Solution:		A conditional format changes the appearance of cells on the basis of conditions that you specify. If the conditions are true, the cell range is formatted; if the conditions are false, the cell range is not formatted.

questions.Question: Which area in an Excel window allows entering values and formulas?
questions.solution: Solution:Formula Bar area in an Excel window allows entering values and formulas. Formula Bar is a toolbar at the top of the Microsoft Excel spreadsheet window that we can use to enter or copy an existing formula in to cells or charts. It is labeled with function symbol (fx). By clicking the Formula Bar, or when you type an equal (=) symbol in a cell, the Formula Bar will activate.

questions.Question: Multiple calculations can be made in a single formula using ________
questions.solution: Solution:		An array formula is a formula that can perform multiple calculations on one or more of the items in an array. We can think of an array as a row of values, a column of values, or a combination of rows and columns of values. Array formulas can return either multiple results or a single result. For example, we can create an array formula in a range of cells and use the array formula to calculate a column or row of subtotals. We can also place an array formula in a single cell and calculate a single amount. An array formula that includes multiple cells is called a multi-cell formula, and an array formula in a single cell is called a single-cell formula.

questions.Question: An Excel Workbook is a collection of ________
questions.solution: Solution:		A workbook is a collection of one or more spreadsheets and charts in a single file.

questions.Question: What do you mean by a Workspace?
questions.solution: Solution:		The term workspace refers to all the open workbooks and their exact screen position and window sizes. A workspace contains pointers to your other Excel files that you had open during your session. When you open an Excel workspace all the other files are opened as well Workspaces are particularly useful if you frequently work with the same set of files and need to have them all open at once.

questions.Question: MS-EXCEL is based on ________
questions.solution: Solution:		MS-Excel is based on Windows. MS-Excel is a spreadsheet developed by Microsoft for Windows and few other operating systems. It is a program that stores and retrieves numerical data in rows and columns of grid format.

questions.Question: Which of the cell pointer indicates you that you can make selection?
questions.optionC: Mouse Pointer with anchor at the tip
questions.solution: Solution:		Doctor’s symbol (Big Plus) indicates we that we can make selection to cell.

questions.Question: Which of the cell pointer indicates that you can fill series?
questions.optionC: Mouse Pointer with anchor at the tip
questions.solution: Solution:		Small thin plus iconcell pointer indicates that you can fill series.

questions.Question: Which of the cell pointer indicate that you can move the content to other cell?
questions.optionC: Mouse Pointer with anchor at the tip
questions.solution: Solution:		Mouse Pointer with anchor at the tip cell pointer indicate that you can move the content to other cell.

questions.Question: You can auto fit the width of column by
questions.optionA: Double clicking on the column name on column header
questions.optionB: Double click on the cell pointer in worksheet
questions.optionC: Double clicking on column right border on column header
questions.optionD: Double clicking on the column left border of column header
questions.solution: Solution:		You can auto fit the width of column by double clicking on column right border on column header.

questions.Question: Long text can be broken down into many lines within a cell. You can do this through
questions.solution: Solution:		Microsoft Excel can wrap text so it appears on multiple lines in a cell. We can format the cell so the text wraps automatically, or enter a manual line break. On the Home tab, in the Alignment group, click Wrap Text.

questions.Question: Which would you choose to create a bar diagram?
questions.solution: Solution:		Click the Insert > Chart

questions.Question: Which setting you must modify to print a worksheet using letterhead?
questions.solution: Solution:		We need to set margins in Excel worksheets before printing, open the “Page Setup” dialog box. To open the “Page Setup” dialog box, click the “Page Layout” tab in the Ribbon.

questions.Question: What do you call the chart that shows the proportions of how one or more data elements relate to another data element?
questions.solution: Solution:		Scatter plot (XY chart) used to show scientific XY data. Scatter plots are often used to find out if there's a relationship between variable X and Y. Line charts are used to display trends over time. Use a line chart if you have text labels, dates or a few numeric labels on the horizontal axis.Pie charts are used to display the contribution of each value (slice) to a total (pie). Pie charts always use one data series. Column charts are used to compare values across categories by using vertical bars.

questions.Question: The spelling dialog box can be involved by choosing spelling from ________ menu.
questions.solution: Solution:		In Excel 2003 and earlier version Tools > Spelling From Excel 2007 and higher version Ribbon > Review tab > Proofing group > Spelling

questions.Question: Which key do you press to check spelling?
questions.solution: Solution:		In most Microsoft Office apps (including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook), tap F7 to begin the spellcheck process.

questions.Question: Status indicators are located on the
questions.solution: Solution:		Status indicators are located on the formula bar.

questions.Question: Which of the following is the oldest spreadsheet package?
questions.solution: Solution:		VisiCalc was the first computer spreadsheet program. It was released to the public in 1979, running on an Apple II computer. While most early microprocessor computers had been quickly supported by BASIC and a few games, VisiCalc introduced a new level in application software. It was considered a fourth generation software program.

questions.Question: Rounding errors can occur
questions.optionA: When you use multiplication, division, or exponentiation in a formula
questions.optionB: When you use addition and subtraction in a formula
questions.optionC: Because excel uses hidden decimal places in computation
questions.optionD: When you show the results of formulas with different decimal places that the calculated results
questions.solution: Solution:		When we use multiplication, division, or exponentiation in a formula, rounding errors can occur.

questions.Question: You can copy data or formulas
questions.optionA: With the copy, paste and cut commands on the edit menu
questions.optionB: With commands on the shortcut menu
questions.optionC: With buttons on the standard toolbars
questions.solution: Solution:		We can copy data or formulas with the copy, paste and cut commands on the edit menu or with commands on the shortcut menu or with buttons on the standard toolbars in Excel 2003 or earlier version.

questions.Question: You cannot link excel worksheet data to a word document
questions.optionC: With the copy and paste special commands
questions.optionD: With the copy and paste buttons on the standard toolbar
questions.solution: Solution:		We cannot link excel worksheet data to a word document with the copy and paste buttons on the standard toolbar.

questions.Question: A worksheet can have a maximum of ________ number of rows.
questions.solution: Solution:		Excel 2003 and earlier 65,536 Rows.Excel 2007 and higher 1,048,576 Rows.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not an example of a value?
questions.solution: Solution:		Serial Number 50771 is alpha numeric can not be considered as value.

questions.Question: The chart wizard term data series refers to
questions.optionB: A collection of chart data markers
questions.optionC: A set of values you plot in a chart
questions.solution: Solution:		The chart wizard term data series refers to a collection of chart data markers.

questions.Question: The Chart wizard term data categories refers to;
questions.optionC: The organization of individual values with a chart’s data series
questions.optionD: The data range that supply chart data
questions.solution: Solution:		The Chart wizard term data categories refers to a horizontal axis.

questions.Question: A worksheet range is a
questions.optionA: A command used for data modeling
questions.optionB: A range of values such as from 23 to 234
questions.solution: Solution:		A worksheet range is a group of cells.

questions.Question: Which of the following series type is not valid for Fill Series dialog box?
questions.solution: Solution:		Time series type is not valid for Fill Series dialog box in excel.

questions.Question: Which of the following you can paste selectively using Paste Special command?
questions.solution: Solution:		We can paste formula, value, formats, comments, validation using Paste Special command.

questions.Question: Paste Special allows some operation while you paste to new cell. Which of the following operation is valid?
questions.solution: Solution:		Paste Special allows Divide operation while you paste to new cell.

questions.Question: Edit > Delete command
questions.optionA: Deletes the content of a cell
questions.solution: Solution:		Deletes selected cells through Edit > Delete command was available in Excel 2003 and earlier versions.

questions.Question: To remove the content of selected cells you must issue ______ command
questions.solution: Solution:		To remove the content of selected cells we must issue Clear Contents command. Clear Contents will clear only the data, will not clear any formats.

questions.Question: When you copy a formula
questions.optionA: Excel erases the original copy of the formula
questions.optionB: Excel edits cell references in the newly copied formula
questions.optionD: Excel doesn’t adjust relative cell references
questions.solution: Solution:		When you copy a formula Excel edits cell references in the newly copied formula.

questions.Question: The autofill feature
questions.optionA: Extends a sequential series of data
questions.optionB: Automatically adds range of cell values
questions.optionC: Applies a boarder around the selected cells
questions.solution: Solution:		AutoFill feature of Excel is a great time saver. This command can automatically extend the sequence, adds range of cell values, applies a boarder around the selected cells.

questions.Question: Which menu option can be used to split windows into two
questions.solution: Solution:View > Window > Split option can be used to split windows into two.

questions.Question: Which of the following is an absolute cell reference?
questions.solution: Solution:		The absolute cell reference in excel is a cell address that contains a dollar sign ($). It can precede the column reference, the row reference or both.

questions.Question: What symbol is used before a number to make it a label?
questions.solution: Solution:		An apostrophe before a cell value forces Excel to interpret the value as label. This is mostly useful for values that look like a number or date.

questions.Question: To record a sequence of keystrokes and mouse actions to play back later we use:
questions.solution: Solution:		Macro Recorder records your mouse movements, mouse clicks and keyboard input. Just like a tape recorder for your computer.

questions.Question: We can save and protect the workbook by
questions.solution: Solution:		We can save and protect the workbook by Encrypt a Workbook with a Password, Make a Workbook Read-Only, Protect a Workbook’s Structure, Protect a Worksheet from Editing, Protect Specific Cells From Editing.

questions.Question: The first cell in EXCEL worksheet is labeled as
questions.solution: Solution:		The first cell in EXCEL worksheet is labeled as A1.

questions.Question: What happens when dollar signs ($) are entered in a cell address? (e$B$2:$B$10)
questions.optionA: An absolute cell address is created
questions.optionB: Cell address will change when it is copied to another cell
questions.optionD: The status bar does not display the cell address
questions.solution: Solution:		The absolute cell reference in excel is a cell address that contains a dollar sign ($). It can precede the column reference, the row reference or both.

questions.Question: What are the tabs that appear at the bottom of each workbook called?
questions.solution: Solution:		In Excel, a sheet, sheet tab, or worksheet tab is used to display the worksheet that a user is currently editing. By clicking a worksheet tab (located at the bottom of the workbook), users may move between the various worksheets.

questions.Question: How do you delete a column?
questions.optionA: Select the column heading you want to delete and select the Delete Row button on the standard toolbar
questions.optionB: Select the column heading you want to delete and select Insert Delete from the menu
questions.optionC: Select the row heading you want to delete and select Edit>Delete from the menu
questions.optionD: Right click the column heading you want to delete and select delete from the shortcut menu
questions.solution: Solution:		Right click the column heading you want to delete and select delete from the shortcut menu in Excel 2003.From 2007 and Higher version Home > Delete > Delete Sheet Columns.

questions.Question: How can you find specific information in a list?
questions.optionA: Select Tools > Finder from the menu
questions.optionB: Click the Find button on the standard toolbar
questions.optionC: Select Insert > Find from the menu
questions.optionD: Select Data > Form from the menu to open the Data Form dialog box and click the Criteria button
questions.solution: Solution:		Select Data > Form from the menu to open the Data Form dialog box and click the Criteria button

questions.Question: When integrating word and excel, word is usually the
questions.solution: Solution:		When integrating ms-word and excel, word is usually the Destination and Client .

questions.Question: When a label is too long to fit within a worksheet cell, you typically must
questions.solution: Solution:		When a label is too long to fit within a worksheet cell, we must increase the column width.

questions.Question: The name box
questions.optionA: Shows the location of the previously active cell
questions.optionB: Appears to the left of the formula bar
questions.solution: Solution:		Name Box refers to an input box directly to the left of the formula bar. The Name Box normally displays the address of the "active cell" on the worksheet. You can also use the name box to quickly create a named range.

questions.Question: The Paste Special command lets you copy and paste:
questions.optionA: Multiply the selection by a copied value
questions.optionD: The resulting values of a formula instead of the actual formula
questions.solution: Solution:		The Paste Special command lets you copy and paste the resulting values of a formula instead of the actual formula.

questions.Question: The numbers in our worksheet look like this 1000: You want them to look like this: $1,000.How can you accomplish this?
questions.optionA: You have to retype everything and manually add the dollar signs, commas, and decimals
questions.optionB: Select Format > Money from the menu
questions.optionC: Click the Currency Style button on the formatting toolbar
questions.solution: Solution:		Click the Currency Style button on the formatting toolbar

questions.Question: Excel worksheet cells work very similarly to what common element of the windows graphical user interface
questions.solution: Solution:		Excel worksheet cells work very similarly to Text boxes graphical user interface.

questions.Question: Which of the following options is not located in the Page Setup dialog box?
questions.solution: Solution:

questions.Question: You want to track the progress of the stock market on a daily basis. Which type of chart should you use?
questions.solution: Solution:		A line chart is the most basic and simplest type of stock charts that are used in technical analysis. The line chart is also called a close-only chart as it plots the closing price of the underlying security, with a line connecting the dots formed by the close price.

questions.Question: Which of the following Excel screen components can NOT be turned on or off?
questions.solution: Solution:		Show Formula bar option by clicking the File (or Office button) > Options > Advanced > Display > Show Formula bar. In earlier versions of Excel, you could hide the status bar if you wanted more space available for your worksheets. However, that capability was removed starting with Excel 2007.In earlier versions of Excel, you could hide the tool bar as per requirement. However, that capability was removed starting with Excel 2007 and introduced Ribbon.

questions.Question: What happens when you press Ctrl + X after selecting some cells in Excel?
questions.optionA: The cell content of selected cells disappear from cell and stored in clipboard
questions.optionB: The cells selected are marked for cutting
questions.optionC: The selected cells are deleted and the cells are shifted left
questions.optionD: The selected cells are deleted and cells are shifted up
questions.solution: Solution:		When we pressing the ctrl+x in the Microsoft excel sheet it means we cut the content from that cell simply means the cells selected are marked for cutting and the user has need to move the content from one cell to another cell.

questions.Question: Which of the following option is not available in Paste Special dialog box?
questions.solution: Solution:		To use options from the Paste Special box, click Home > Paste > Paste Special.

questions.Question: Which command will you choose to convert a column of data into row?
questions.solution: Solution:		Transpose (rotate) data from rows to columns or vice versa. To use options from the Paste Special box, click Home > Paste > Paste Special > Transpose

questions.Question: It is acceptable to let long text flow into adjacent cells on a worksheet when
questions.optionA: Data will be entered in the adjacent cells
questions.optionB: No data will be entered in the adjacent cells
questions.optionC: There is no suitable abbreviation for the text
questions.optionD: There is not time to format the text
questions.solution: Solution:		When there is no data in in the adjacent cells, long text flows into adjacent cells on a worksheet. As soon as data is entered into in the adjacent cells, text will be visible upto cell length in which data is entered, For full visibility of data either we need to increase the length of cell or wrap text in particular cell.

questions.Question: MS Excel provides the default value for step in Fill Series dialog box
questions.solution: Solution:		The default value for any series is 1 in Excel.

questions.Question: When a row of data is to be converted into columns
questions.optionA: Copy the cells in row, select the same number of cells in row and paste
questions.optionB: Copy the cells in column then choose Paste Special, then click Transpose and OK
questions.optionC: Copy the cells then go to Cells then on Alignment tab click Transpose check box and click OK
questions.optionD: Select the cells then place the cell pointer on new cell and choose Paste Special, mark Transpose check box and click OK
questions.solution: Solution:		Transpose (rotate) data from rows to columns or vice versa. To use options from the Paste Special box, click Home > Paste > Paste Special > Transpose Select the cells then place the cell pointer on new cell and choose Paste Special, mark Transpose check box and click OK

questions.Question: Ctrl + D shortcut key in Excel will
questions.optionB: Apply double underline for the active cell
questions.solution: Solution:		Ctrl+D fills the cell beneath with the contents of the selected cell in a column. To fill more than one cell, select the source cell and press Ctrl+Shift+Down to select all cells. Then press Ctrl+D to fill them with the contents of the original cell.

questions.Question: The shortcut key Ctrl + R is used in Excel to
questions.optionA: Right align the content of cell
questions.optionB: Remove the cell contents of selected cells
questions.optionC: Fill the selection with active cells to the right
questions.solution: Solution:		Ctrl+R fills the row cell to the right with the contents of the selected cell. To fill more than one cell, select the source cell and press Ctrl+Shift+Right arrow to select multiple cells. Then press Ctrl+R to fill them with the contents of the original cell.

questions.Question: The command Edit > Fill Across Worksheet is active only when
questions.solution: Solution:		Click the Fill button in the Editing group, and then click Across Worksheet a command only appears when we have multiple worksheets selected.

questions.Question: Each excel file is called a workbook because
questions.optionA: It can contain text and data
questions.optionC: It can contain many sheets including worksheets and chart sheets
questions.optionD: You have to work hard to create it
questions.solution: Solution:		A workbook is a collection of one or more spreadsheets and charts in a single file.

questions.Question: Excel probably considers the cell entry January 1, 2020 to be a
questions.solution: Solution:		In Excel Date format is considered as value.

questions.Question: You can enter which types of data into worksheet cells?
questions.optionB: Labels and values but not formulas
questions.optionC: Values and formulas but not labels
questions.solution: Solution:		We can enter Labels, values, and formulas into worksheet cells.

questions.Question: All worksheet formula
questions.solution: Solution:		All worksheet formula returns a formula result.

questions.Question: Which of the following is a correct order of precedence in formula calculation?
questions.optionA: Multiplication and division exponentiation positive and negative values
questions.optionB: Multiplication and division, positive and negative values, addition and subtraction
questions.optionC: Addition and subtraction, positive and negative values, exponentiation
questions.solution: Solution:		None of above is correct order of precedence in formula calculation.

questions.Question: Which tool you will use to join some cells and place the content at the middle of joined cell?
questions.optionA: From Format Cells dialog box click on Merge Cells check box
questions.optionB: From Format Cells dialog box select the Centered alignment
questions.optionC: From Format Cells dialog box choose Merge and Center check box
questions.optionD: Click on Merge and Center tool on formatting toolbar
questions.solution: Solution:		In 2003 and earlier versions -From Format Cells dialog box click on Merge Cells check box In 2007 and subsequent versions - Merge & Center icon on the Home ribbon.

questions.Question: Tab scroll buttons are place on Excel screen
questions.solution: Solution:		On the bottom left of the worksheet we find the Sheet Tab Scroll Buttons to move to the First sheet, Previous sheet, Next sheet, and Last sheet.They are followed by the tabs for the worksheets in our workbook and the Insert Worksheet button or tab, depending on the version of Excel we are using.

questions.Question: The Name box on to the left of formula bar
questions.optionA: Shows the name of workbook currently working on
questions.optionB: Shows the name of worksheet currently working on
questions.optionC: Shows the name of cell or range currently working on
questions.solution: Solution:		Name Box refers to an input box directly to the left of the formula bar. The Name Box normally displays the address of the "active cell" on the worksheet. You can also use the name box to quickly create a named range.

questions.Question: Each excel file is a workbook that contains different sheets. Which of the following can not be a sheet in workbook?
questions.solution: Solution:		Data sheet can not be a sheet in workbook.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not the correct method of editing the cell content?
questions.solution: Solution:		A cell can be edited through Press the F2 key or Click the formula bar or Double click the cell.

questions.Question: Without using the mouse or the arrow keys, what is the fastest way of getting to cell A1 in a spreadsheet?
questions.solution: Solution:Ctrl + Home key is the fastest way of getting to cell A1 in a spreadsheet.

questions.Question: Which of the following methods can not be used to edit the contents of a cell?
questions.solution: Solution:		A cell can be edited through Press the F2 key or Click the formula bar or Double click the cell.

questions.Question: If you begin typing an entry into a cell and then realize that you don't want your entry placed into a cell, you:
questions.solution: Solution:		Pressing the Esc key while editing a cell aborts the operation and leaves the cell in it's original state.

questions.Question: To view a cell comment
questions.optionA: Click the edit comment command on the insert menu
questions.optionB: Click the display comment command on the window menu
questions.optionC: Position the mouse pointer over the cell
questions.optionD: Click the comment command on the view menu
questions.solution: Solution:		Position the mouse pointer over the cell to view a cell comment.

questions.Question: When you want to insert a blank embedded excel object in a word document you can
questions.optionA: Click the object command on the insert menu
questions.optionB: Click the office links button on the standard toolbar
questions.optionC: Click the create worksheet button on the formatting toolbar
questions.optionD: Click the import excel command on the file menu
questions.solution: Solution:		For inserting a blank embedded excel object in a word document we can click the object command on the insert menu.

questions.Question: It is acceptable to let long text flow into adjacent cells on a worksheet when
questions.optionA: Data will be entered in the adjacent cells
questions.optionB: No data will be entered in the adjacent cells
questions.optionC: There is no suitable abbreviation of the text
questions.optionD: There is not time to format the next
questions.solution: Solution:		When there is no data in in the adjacent cells, long text flows into adjacent cells on a worksheet. As soon as data is entered into in the adjacent cells, text will be visible upto cell length in which data is entered, For full visibility of data either we need to increase the length of cell or wrap text in particular cell.

questions.Question: How can you delete a record?
questions.optionA: Delete the column from the worksheet
questions.optionB: Select Data > Form from the menu to open the Data Form dialog box, find the record and Click the Delete button
questions.optionC: Select Data > Delete Record from the menu
questions.optionD: Click the Delete button on the Standard toolbar
questions.solution: Solution:		Select Data > Form from the menu to open the Data Form dialog box, find the record and Click the Delete button in Excel 2003 and earlier version.

questions.Question: Right clicking something in Excel:
questions.optionB: Nothing the right mouse button is there for left handed people
questions.optionC: Opens a shortcut menu listing everything you can do to the object
questions.solution: Solution:		Right clicking something in Excel opens a shortcut menu listing everything you can do to the object.

questions.Question: Documentation should include
questions.optionA: Destination and users of the output data
questions.optionC: Information on the purpose of the workbook
questions.solution: Solution:		Documentation should include Source of input data Destination and users of the output data Information on the purpose of the workbook.

questions.Question: Files created with Lotus 1-2-3 have an extension
questions.solution: Solution:		Lotus 1-2-3 have an extension .123

questions.Question: Getting data from a cell located in a different sheet is called ________
questions.solution: Solution:		Getting data from a cell located in a different sheet is called Cell reference. There are Three types of Cell reference in ExcelRelativeAbsoluteMixed

questions.Question: Which of the following is not a valid data type in Excel?
questions.solution: Solution:		There are Three types of data in cells: labels, values, and formulas. Labels (text) are descriptive pieces of information, such as names, months, or other identifying statistics, and they usually include alphabetic characters. Values (numbers) are generally raw numbers or dates. Formulas are instructions for Excel to perform calculations.

questions.Question: Which elements of a worksheet can be protected from accidental modification?
questions.solution: Solution:		All elements of a worksheet can be protected from accidental modification.To protect a worksheet in Excel 2007 and higher versions, click the Review tab, click Protect Worksheet (or Protect Sheet), and click OK.Excel 2003 and Earlier Versions click Tools > Protection, click Protect Sheet, and click OK.

questions.Question: A numeric value can be treated as label value if ________ precedes it.
questions.solution: Solution:		An apostrophe before a cell value forces Excel to interpret the value as text. This is mostly useful for values that look like a number or date.

questions.Question: Concatenation of text can be done using
questions.solution: Solution:		The ampersand (&) calculation operator allow us join text items without using a function. For example, =A1 & B1 will return the same value as =CONCATENATE(A1,B1). In many cases, using the ampersand operator is quicker and simpler than using CONCATENATE to create strings.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not a basic step in creating a worksheet?
questions.solution: Solution:		Copy the worksheet is not a basic step in creating a worksheet.

questions.Question: How do you select an entire column?
questions.optionA: Select Edit > Select > Column from the menu
questions.optionC: Hold down the shift key as you click anywhere in the column
questions.optionD: Hold down the Ctrl key as you click anywhere in the column
questions.solution: Solution:		To select an entire column in MS-EXCEL, Click the column heading letter or press CTRL + Space Bar key.

questions.Question: How can you print three copies of a workbook?
questions.optionA: Select File > Properties form the menu and type 3 in the Copies to print text box
questions.optionB: Select File > Print from the menu and type 3 in the Number of copies text box
questions.optionC: Click the Print button on the standard toolbar to print the document then take it to Kinko’s and have 2 more copies made
questions.solution: Solution:		Select File > Print from the menu and type 3 in the Number of copies text box

questions.Question: To create a formula, you first:
questions.optionA: Select the cell you want to place the formula into
questions.optionB: Type the equals sign (=) to tell Excel that you’re about to enter a formula
questions.optionC: Enter the formula using any input values and the appropriate mathematical operators that make up your formula
questions.optionD: Choose the new command from the file menu
questions.solution: Solution:		A formula always starts with an equal sign (=), which can be followed by numbers, math operators (such as a plus or minus sign), and functions, which can really expand the power of a formula.

questions.Question: To center worksheet titles across a range of cells, you must
questions.optionA: Select the cells containing the title text plus the range over which the title text is to be centered
questions.optionC: Select the cells containing the title text plus the range over which the title text is to be enfettered
questions.optionD: Format the cells with the comma style
questions.solution: Solution:		Select the cells containing the title text plus the range over which the title text is to be centered

questions.Question: Which symbol must all formula begin with?
questions.solution: Solution:		A formula always starts with an equal sign (=), which can be followed by numbers, math operators (such as a plus or minus sign), and functions, which can really expand the power of a formula.

questions.Question: Which of the following formulas is not entered correctly?
questions.solution: Solution:		A formula always starts with an equal sign (=), which can be followed by numbers, math operators (such as a plus or minus sign), and functions, which can really expand the power of a formula. Here in option D 10+50 there is no equal sign (=), so it is not correct.

questions.Question: Which of the following formulas will Excel not be able to calculate?
questions.solution: Solution:		SUM function returns the sum of values supplied. These values can be numbers, cell references, ranges, arrays, and constants, in any combination. Here =SUM(Sales) is incorrect if it is not name of any range.

questions.Question: A typical worksheet has ________ number of columns.
questions.solution: Solution:		Excel 2003 and earlier 256 (as label 'IV') columns. Excel 2007 and higher 16,384 (as label 'XFD') columns.

questions.Question: How many characters can be typed in a single cell in Excel?
questions.solution: Solution:		A cell can contain 32,767 number of characters.

questions.Question: To activate the previous cell in a pre-selected range, press
questions.solution: Solution:		To go to previous cell we use Go To function Ctrl + G.

questions.Question: Which button do you click to add up a series of numbers?
questions.solution: Solution:		AutoSum is a Microsoft Excel function that adds together a range of cells and displays the total in the cell below the selected range.

questions.Question: When the formula bar is active, you can see
questions.solution: Solution:		Three buttons Cancel, Enter, and Function Wizard appear in the Formula bar. When the formula bar is active, we can see all.

questions.Question: To copy formatting from one area in a worksheet and apply it to another area you would use:
questions.optionA: The Edit > Copy Format and Edit>Paste Format commands form the menu
questions.optionB: The Copy and Apply Formatting dialog box, located under the Format > Copy and Apply menu
questions.optionC: There is no way to copy and apply formatting in Excel – You have to do it manually
questions.optionD: The Format Painter button on the standard toolbar
questions.solution: Solution:		The Format Painter copies formatting from one place and applies it to another. The Format Painter button on the standard toolbar in Excel 2003 and earlier version. Home tab, in the Clipboard group, click Format Painter in 2007 and higher version.

questions.Question: In a worksheet you can select
questions.solution: Solution:		In a worksheet we can select cell or range of cells or rows or columns or entire worksheet.

questions.Question: To delete an embedded objects, first
questions.optionB: Select the object by clicking it
questions.optionD: Select it and then press the delete key
questions.solution: Solution:		To delete an embedded objects, first select it and then press the delete key.

questions.Question: Comments can be added to cells using
questions.solution: Solution:		Comments can be added to cells using Insert > Comments.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not a worksheet design criterion?
questions.solution: Solution:		Description

questions.Question: To copy cell contents using drag and drop press the
questions.solution: Solution:		To copy cell contents using drag and drop press the Ctrl key else it will move the data.

questions.Question: Which of the following is the latest version of Excel
questions.solution: Solution:		Office 365, always receive updates to the latest version of Office.

questions.Question: You can convert existing excel worksheet data an charts to an HTML document by using
questions.solution: Solution:		The Internet Assistant for Excel is an add-in wizard that allows you to create and distribute Excel documents online for viewing with any popular browser. The Internet Assistant helps you convert your spreadsheet data to HTML format. It is designed for the 1997 and earlier versions of Excel.

questions.Question: A circular reference is
questions.optionB: A cell that points to a drawing object
questions.optionC: A formula that either directly or indirectly depends on itself
questions.solution: Solution:		A circular reference occurs when a formula directly or indirectly refers to its own cell. This causes the formula to use its result in the calculation, which can create errors.

questions.Question: Which of following is Not one of Excel's what-if function?
questions.solution: Solution:		Goal seek, Scenario Manager and Solver are used to perform what if analysis in Excel.

questions.Question: When you insert an excel file into a word document. The data are
questions.optionA: Hyperlinked placed in a word table
questions.optionD: Use the word menu bar and toolbars
questions.solution: Solution:		When we insert an excel file into a word document and keep the source file linkage when data is updated in source file update data in liked file also. The data are Linked. In Embedded objects file become part of document and does not get updated when source file is updated.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not information you can specify using the solver?
questions.solution: Solution:		Solver is used to find an optimal (maximum or minimum) value for a formula in one cell — called the objective cell — subject to constraints, or limits, on the values of other formula cells on a worksheet. Solver works with a group of cells, called decision variables or simply variable cells that are used in computing the formulas in the objective and constraint cells. Versions of Solver prior to Excel 2007 referred to the objective cell as the "target cell," and the decision variable cells as "changing cells" or "adjustable cells".

questions.Question: How do you display current date only in MS Excel?
questions.solution: Solution:		DATE - returns the serial date value for a date TODAY - returns today's date NOW - returns the current date and time TIME - assemble a proper time.

questions.Question: How do you wrap the text in a cell?
questions.solution: Solution:		Microsoft Excel can wrap text so it appears on multiple lines in a cell. We can format the cell so the text wraps automatically, or enter a manual line break. On the Home tab, in the Alignment group, click Wrap Text.

questions.Question: What does COUNTA () function do?
questions.solution: Solution:		COUNTA function counts cells containing any type of information, including error values. COUNTA function does not count empty cells.

questions.Question: What is the short cut key to highlight the entire column?
questions.solution: Solution:Ctrl + Space Bar is the short cut key to highlight the entire column.

questions.Question: In the formula, which symbol specifies the fixed columns or rows?
questions.solution: Solution:		The absolute cell reference in excel is a cell address that contains a dollar sign ($). It can precede the column reference, the row reference or both.

questions.Question: What is represented by the small, black square in the lower-right corner of an active cell or range?
questions.solution: Solution:		Fill handle is a feature to extend (and fill) a series of numbers, dates, or even text to a desired number of cells in Excel. In the active cell of the spreadsheet, the fill handle is a small black box at the bottom right corner, as shown in the image.

questions.Question: In Excel, a Data Series is defined as what?
questions.solution: Solution:		In Excel, a Data Series is defined as a collection of related data. A data series is just a fancy name for a collection of related numbers in the same row, or the same column.

questions.Question: In Excel, the Fill Color button on the Formatting toolbar is used for what?
questions.optionC: To select a distribution of figures
questions.optionD: To add shading or color to a cell range
questions.solution: Solution:		Fill Color is used to add or change the background color or pattern of cells.

questions.Question: In help menu of Excel, which of the following tabs are found?
questions.solution: Solution:		In help menu of Excel 2003, Contents tab, Answer Wizard tab, Index tab are available.

questions.Question: A ________ is a grid with labeled columns and rows.
questions.solution: Solution:		A worksheet in Excel is made up of Rows and Columns grids. Intersection of a Row and column in an Excel worksheet is a rectangle called as a Cell. Cells store a value, a formula, or text.

questions.Question: The active cell:
questions.optionA: Is defined by a bold border around the cell
questions.optionB: Receives the data the user enters
questions.solution: Solution:		An active cell is a rectangular box that highlights (a bold border around) the cell in a spreadsheet. An active cell helps identify what cell is being worked with and where data will be entered.

questions.Question: Which function is used to calculate depreciation, rates of return, future values and loan payment amounts?
questions.solution: Solution:		Financial Functions are used to calculate depreciation, rates of return, future values and loan payment amounts. A list of Excel Financial Functions in Excel are: ⇒Investment value functions including 1. FV 2. FVSCHEDULE 3. NPV 4. PV 5. RECEIVED 6. XNPV ⇒Internal rate of return functions including 1. IRR 2. MIRR 3. XIRR ⇒Asset depreciation functions including 1. AMORDEGRC 2. AMORLINC 3. DB 4. DDB 5. SLN 6. SYD 7. VDB ⇒Payment functions including 1. CUMIPMT 2. CUMPRINC 3. IPMT 4. ISPMT 5. PMT 6. PPMT ⇒Dollar conversion including 1. DOLLARDE 2. DOLLARFR ⇒Yield functions including 1. YIELD 2. YIELDDISC 3. YIELDMAT 4. ODDFYIELD 5. ODDLYIELD 6. TBILLEO 7. TBILLYIELD ⇒Price functions including 1. PRICE 2. PRICEDISC 3. PRICEMAT 4. ODDFPRICE 5. ODDLPRICE 6. TBILLPRICE

questions.Question: B7:B9 indicates:
questions.optionA: Cells B7 and cell B9 only
questions.solution: Solution:		B7:B9 indicates a range of cell between Cells B7 through B9.

questions.Question: The Cancel and Enter buttons appear in the:
questions.solution: Solution:		Three buttons Cancel, Enter, and Function Wizard appear in the Formula bar.

questions.Question: Which of the following methods cannot be used to enter data in a cell
questions.solution: Solution:		Pressing the Esc key while editing a cell aborts the operation and leaves the cell in it's original state.

questions.Question: Microsoft Excel is a powerful ________
questions.solution: Solution:		Microsoft Excel is Microsoft's general-purpose spreadsheet program for Windows, used for data analysis and display. It is commonly used in a business environment since it is part of the Microsoft Office package. Microsoft Excel is an extremely powerful tool, which is used by millions of people everyday. Functions tailored to a specific task can be programmed into Excel to extend its capabilities with customised analysis tools.

questions.Question: How do you rearrange the data in ascending or descending order?
questions.solution: Solution:		Sorting data in MS Excel rearranges the rows based on the contents of a particular column. We can also sort a table to put names in alphabetical order or ascending or descending order. Or, maybe we want to sort data by Amount from smallest to largest or largest to smallest.

questions.Question: Which Chart can be created in Excel?
questions.solution: Solution:		Excel offers the following major chart types − Column Chart Line Chart Pie Chart Doughnut Chart Bar Chart Area Chart XY (Scatter) Chart Bubble Chart Stock Chart Surface Chart Radar Chart Combo Chart

questions.Question: What will be the output if you format the cell containing 5,436.8 as '#,##0.00' ?
How do you display current date and time in MS Excel?
questions.solution: Solution:		DATE - returns the serial date value for a date TODAY - returns today's date NOW - returns the current date and time TIME - assemble a proper time.
